episode.description: Chinese lawyer Tang Shuai uses sign language to protect the legal rights of his clients who have hearing difficulties. He hopes for a law-abiding society that is more considerate to their needs.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Famous for its "Freak Cabaret" performances, the Ukrainian music and theater band Dakh Daughters sings about the harsh situation in Ukraine. Its vocalist explains the thoughts behind the lyrics.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Ki Moran, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with the government.
episode.description: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Moran Ki, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with government.
episode.subtitle: The Story Behind COVID-19 Measures: Ki Moran / Professor, Department of Cancer Control and Population Health at the National Cancer Center
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Dominique Chen, known for his outstanding research in the field of information studies, talks about ways to achieve well-being through digital communications.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: With amazing economic growth in recent years, Rwanda has been pursuing a progressive ICT policy. The woman appointed Minister of ICT and Innovation at merely 35 talks about the future ICT offers.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Saengduean Chailert, the founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episode.description: Saengduean Chailert, founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episode.subtitle: All Life on Earth Is Equal: Saengduean Chailert / Founder of Save Elephant Foundation, Director of Elephant Nature Park
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.description: Anoushka Shankar is a sitarist, composer and producer who has won many awards in the world music scene. She is the daughter of Indian musician Ravi Shankar. She is also a social activist and feminist.
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet and opera.
episode.description: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet, and opera.
episode.subtitle: Communicating With Music: Max Richter / Composer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episode.description: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episode.subtitle: Giving the Joy of Running: Endo Ken / Prosthetic Leg Engineer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.description: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episode.subtitle: Enriching People's Lives With Coffee: Lee Ayu Chuepa / Founder of Akha Ama Coffee, Social Entrepreneur
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episode.description: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episode.subtitle: Original Magic That Captivates the World: HARA / Illusionist
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episode.description: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episode.subtitle: Behind the Logo: Shimada Tamotsu / Graphic Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.description: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episode.subtitle: The Forgotten Refugees: Josie Naughton / Co-founder & CEO Help Refugees
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Lilian Thuram, a former football star who contributed to the victory of France in FIFA World Cup 1998, has fought with his foundation against racism through books, exhibitions and workshops since 2008.
episode.description: Lilian Thuram, former football star who contributed the victory of France in FIFA World Cup 1998, has fought with his foundation against racism through books, exhibitions and workshops since 2008.
episode.subtitle: Freeing the World of Racism: Lilian Thuram / Anti-Discrimination Advocate
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.description: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episode.subtitle: Bringing the Lights Back to Broadway: Yasuhiro Kawana / Theater Producer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episode.description: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episode.subtitle: Building Bridges to Diversity: Stella Jean / Fashion Designer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episode.description: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episode.subtitle: Ideal Framing: Konno Shinichi / Bicycle Framebuilder
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Purintei Merin performs Rakugo, a type of storytelling that has a more than 400-year history. She writes and delivers original pieces in both Japanese and English. Hear her story.
episode.description: Purintei Merin performs rakugo, a type of storytelling that has a more than 400-year history. She writes and delivers original pieces in both Japanese and English. Hear her story.
episode.subtitle: A New Style of Sit-Down Comedy: Purintei Merin / Rakugo Storyteller
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.description: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episode.subtitle: Command Your Spaceship in Isolation: Chris Hadfield / Former Astronaut
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: In 2017, Fujiki Daichi became the first Asian countertenor to debut at the Vienna State Opera. What does he wish to convey to audiences through his dazzling performances?
episode.description: In 2017, Fujiki Daichi became the first Asian countertenor to debut at the Vienna State Opera. What does he wish to convey to audiences through his dazzling performances?
episode.subtitle: Reaching Operatic Heights: Fujiki Daichi / Countertenor
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episode.description: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episode.subtitle: Technology's Power to Shape Us: James Nolan / Professor of Sociology
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Kogenji Ryota is a world champion pole dancer who was named Mr. Pole Dance 2020. How does he come up with his routines, for which audiences have described him as being like a floating white fairy?
episode.description: Kogenji Ryota is a world champion pole dancer who was named Mr. Pole Dance 2020. How does he come up with his routines, for which audiences have described him as being like a floating white fairy?
episode.subtitle: A Perch to Be Myself: Kogenji Ryota / Pole Dancer
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episode.description: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episode.subtitle: The Fight Against Misinformation: Claire Wardle / Social Media Expert
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.description: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episode.subtitle: Bridging the Division: Yukari Tangena Suzuki / Chairperson "The Foundation Dialogue Netherlands-Japan-Indonesia"
episode.title: Direct Talk

episode.content: Mounir Biba, multiple world champion of Breaking, runs the project about breaking and coaching to support young people. He also contributed to the promotion of Breaking for Olympic sports inclusion.
episode.description: Mounir Biba, multiple world champion of Breaking, runs the project about breaking and coaching to support young people. He contributed also to the promotion of Breaking for Olympic sports inclusion.
episode.subtitle: Breaking Makes Everything Possible: Mounir Biba / Breaker/Motivational Coach
